test.name: tx_descriptor_status
test.objective: Prove that Tx descriptor status callback readings are consistent

results.notes: At least two TX queues must be supported

result.verdict: So many Tx queues are not supported
Tx descriptor status retrieval is not supported

results.notes: Descriptor status for a descriptor with a less than 512 offset will not return EINVAL. EF10 implementation of Tx descriptor status does not include event processing so the status of the first descriptor is FULL

result.verdict: Bogus status for the non-existing descriptor
Status of the first descriptor is FULL after single Tx burst

results.notes: If Tx ring size is just 1, real size of Tx ring is 512 and requested size is just a software limit

result.verdict: Bogus status for the non-existing descriptor

results.notes: Xilinx Virtio does not support control queue, so only one Tx queue is available according to specification (5.1.2 Virtqueues), but test sets two

result.verdict: rte_eth_dev_configure() failed: RPC-EINVAL

results.notes: VirtIO PMD does not support Tx descriptor status callback

result.verdict: Tx descriptor status retrieval is not supported
Status of the first descriptor is FULL after single Tx burst
